DOC.brief_summary: This study compare efficacy safety mometasone furoate/formoterol fumarate ( MF/F ) 100/10 mcg mometasone furoate ( MF ) 100 mcg , administer metered-dose inhaler , 5- 11-year-old child persistent asthma . This study evaluate change forced expiratory volume one second ( FEV1 ) baseline measure pulmonary function
DOC.brief_title: Study Safety Efficacy Mometasone Furoate Used Combination With Formoterol Fumarate Compared With Mometasone Furoate Children ( 5 11 Years Age ) With Persistent Asthma ( MK-0887A-087 )
DOC.criteria: Has diagnosis asthma ≥ 6months duration prior study start Has asthma adequately control , accord clinical judgment investigator , stable dose inhale corticosteroid ( ICS ) combine longacting betaagonist ( LABA ) ≥ 4 week prior study start Is able demonstrate screening , FEV1 > 60 % ≤90 % predict Is able demonstrate screening , increase absolute FEV1 least 12 % within 30 minute administration albuterol/salbutamol . Requires > 8 inhalation per day albuterol ( 100 mcg per actuation ) , and/or > 2 nebulized treatment per day 2.5 mg albuterol 2 consecutive day screen visit study start Has clinical worsen asthma screen visit study start , result emergency room visit ( asthma exacerbation ) , hospitalization due asthma , treatment additional , exclude asthma medication ( SABA ) . Has experience upper low respiratory tract infection within 4 week prior screen Is consider investigator unstable asthma end runin period Has > 4 asthma exacerbation ( define worsen asthma require systemic corticosteroid use and/or ≥ 24hour stay emergency department , urgent care center , hospital ) within 1 year screen visit Has history lifethreatening asthma , include asthma episode require intubation and/or associate increase carbon dioxide level blood require noninvasive ventilator support
